lessons.japanese: 気楽に行こうぜ。大丈夫、形勢は君に有利なのだから。
lessons.english: Take it easy. I can assure you that chances are in your favor.

lessons.japanese: それで形勢が変わった。
lessons.english: That altered the aspect of the case.

lessons.japanese: さあ、くよくよしないで。形勢は君に有利なんだから。
lessons.english: Come on, take it easy. Chances are in your favor.

lessons.japanese: ２人を比較すると彼の方が形勢不利だった。
lessons.english: The comparison between the two was to his disadvantage.
Now the shoe is on the other foot.

lessons.japanese: 形勢は２対１で不利、勝ち目は半分。
lessons.english: The chances are two to one against us.
